intro: Phthirusa savannarum, commonly known as the savanna phthirus, is a flowering plant native to the savannas of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellow-orange flower heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to seasonal droughts. Phthirusa savannarum is often found in open grasslands and is an important component of the local flora.
